meanings.definition: Entrappers: those who ensnare or trap others
meanings.sent1: The entrappers set up traps to catch animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the entrappers who were illegally hunting in the protected area.
meanings.sent3: The entrappers accidentally trapped themselves in their own net while trying to catch a rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The entrappers of the group were skilled at catching fish using handmade nets.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the entrappers who try to deceive you with their cunning tricks.

meanings.definition: Entrappers: to ensnare or trap someone
meanings.sent1: She entrappers unsuspecting travelers by pretending to need help.
meanings.sent2: The spider entrappers insects in its web to eat later.
meanings.sent3: The magician entrappers the audience with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The hunter entrappers the deer by laying out bait in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The villain entrappers the hero in a cleverly laid trap.

meanings.definition: Entrappers: the act of ensnaring or trapping someone
meanings.sent1: The entrappers of wild animals requires patience and skill.
meanings.sent2: The entrappers of criminals by the police led to a decrease in crime rates.
meanings.sent3: The entrappers of the escape artist failed as he managed to slip out of the handcuffs.
meanings.sent4: The entrappers of the treasure chest was a challenging task for the adventurers.
meanings.sent5: The entrappers of the spy revealed crucial information to the authorities.
